findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The smart contract has a potential vulnerability where an unauthorized user can upgrade the script.

findings.title: Unprotected function calls
findings.description: The contracts IERC20, IPinkAntiBot contain unprotected external function calls which can lead to reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: Lack of access control on critical functions
findings.description: The contract allows unauthorized access to critical functions.

findings.title: Unsecured use of transfer and approve functions
findings.description: The contract uses unsecured transfer and approve functions which can lead to unauthorized token transfers.

findings.title: Unrestricted allowance increase and decrease
findings.description: The functions 'increaseAllowance' and 'decreaseAllowance' are public and do not have any access modifiers or restrictions, allowing anyone to increase or decrease the allowance of a user.

findings.title: Unprotected excludeFromReward and includeInReward functions
findings.description: The excludeFromReward and includeInReward functions are unprotected and can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized changes to the reward system.

findings.title: Unprotected setTaxFeeBuyPercent, setTaxFeeSellPercent, setOptionalDevFeeBuyPercent, and setOptionalDevFeeSellPercent functions
findings.description: The functions setTaxFeeBuyPercent, setTaxFeeSellPercent, setOptionalDevFeeBuyPercent, and setOptionalDevFeeSellPercent are unprotected, allowing unauthorized access to modify fee percentages.
